column1: The Northway was a road in the Shire. It is named as such only in the 1960 rewrite of The Hobbit
column2: published in The History of The Hobbit: Return to Bag-End
column3: so it may not be considered canonical.

column1: The road sprang from the Great East Road just west of Frogmorton
column3: and led to Oatbarton.  A side-road branched off just before the Northway reached the Northfarthing and stretched to Dwaling and Brockenbores. On the intersection stood an inn
